item.title: Marketplace Video
item.description: Video ads offer a valuable opportunity to drive more revenue for your interstitial inventory.  MoPub enables you to automatically introduce video ads from MoPub Marketplace demand partners without burdening your app with additional SDKs. Our video ad support is built to give you the...

item.title: Refresh Rates
item.description: When you create an ad unit, you will need to set the refresh rate. The refresh rate is the number of seconds until the next ad unit displays. For example, if you set a refresh rate of 30 seconds, the second ad unit will display 30 seconds later...

item.title: Reporting Categories and Metrics Descriptions
item.description: When running a report, you can report on six categories and include desired metrics. The following are categories on which you can report: App Ad Unit Priority Line Item Type Order Line Item Creative Month Week Day Hour Country OS iOS Device For example, if you wanted to report on a single Line...

item.title: Forecasting for Direct Ads
item.description: Overview of Forecasting MoPub’s Forecasting feature allows you to quickly evaluate available impressions based on the inventory that’s already been booked and sold. As shown below, Forecasting allows you to visualize available inventory, and see the value of each Guaranteed Line Item. This...

item.title: Location and Keyword Data Passing
item.description: Data passing allows for more relevant and targeted ad content to be displayed to the user. Currently MoPub is able to allow for location and keyword data to be passed. Location Passing Android will automatically pass over Latitude and Longitude coordinates if available Keywords Passing You can...

item.title: How To Integrate Facebook Audience Network Using Custom Events
item.description: You can work with Facebook's Audience Network using Custom Events the same way you can with other ad network on MoPub. MoPub's pre-built Custom Event adapter makes this process even simpler. For more information on Custom Events, see Ad Network Setup.Important Note: These Custom Events are...

item.title: Checking the MoPub SDK Version
item.description: As a best practice, we recommend that you update to the most recent version of the MoPub SDK every time you push an update to the Apple App Store or Google Play Store. To check the version of the SDK that is currently integrated in your application, you can look at the MoPub.java file for Android...

item.title: Technical Integration FAQ
item.description: I’m testing my ad unit and nothing is happening. Why? At the moment, ad units that aren't receiving ad requests from live traffic get removed from our ad servers periodically. When the ad unit starts receiving traffic again, the information gets loaded on those machines and there's a short delay...

item.title: AdMarvel Integration
item.description: When using the AdMarvel SDK, passing IFA and AndroidID can dramatically affect Marketplace performance. For iOS: AdMarvel SDK version 3.0.1 or higher is required to pass IDFA and work correctly with Marketplace. For Android: All versions of the AdMarvel SDK pass AndroidID and are ...

item.title: Setting Up Conversion Tracking
item.description: Conversion tracking is used to properly measure the effectiveness of cross-promotions and direct sold advertisements.  Therefore, we recommend that publishers always implement conversion tracking. The conversion tracking network event only happens once-- a file is stored on device so that the...

item.title: Orders & Line Items Setup
item.description: An Order is a set of Line Items, usually created for an ad campaign. The Order targets one or more Ad Units to display creatives After logging into app.mopub.com, go to your ‘Orders’ tab. Click on the ‘Add a New Order’ button at the top right. Name your Order, drop in the Advertiser, and add a...

item.title: Orders & Line Items Settings
item.description: Within MoPub’s dashboard, Orders & Line Item settings can be adjusted on different ad sources for a particular ad unit. Line item types include: Guaranteed (G), Network (N), MoPub Marketplace (M), Promotional (P), Non-Guaranteed (NG), or Backfill Promotional (B). More information on Line Item...

item.title: Orders & Line Items FAQ
item.description: My line item is currently paused and I would like to set it live. When I do so, the line item remains in the paused state.What is going on? Please check the status of the order to which the line item belongs, and ensure that the order is set live. The order level supersedes the line item level, so...

item.title: Order & Line Item Types
item.description: Order Types There are four campaign types that MoPub supports to help with creating ad serving strategies. MoPub prioritizes Orders in the following sequence: guaranteed, promotional, networks, Marketplace, and then backfill promotional. Within each category of Orders, CPM is used to prioritize....

item.title: MoPub Macros
item.description: MoPub supports the following macros for a publisher’s 3rd party ad tags and trackers: Click URL (Unescaped):  %%CLICK_URL_UNESC%%  Click URL (Escaped):  %%CLICK_URL_ESC%%  Cache Buster (Generates a random number): %%CACHEBUSTER%% Ad Group ID: %eaid! Creative ID: %ecid...

item.title: Managing Orders & Line Items
item.description: You can manage your Orders & Line Items directly from the Orders page. Checking the box next to each of the Orders allows you to pause, resume, and archive. The Quick Jump button allows you to quickly jump between...

item.title: Integer Priority Levels
item.description: Integer Priority Levels enables publishers to assign priority levels to line items in their waterfall independent of the Line Item Type. Line Item Type and Priority are now independent from each other.How are Line Items Prioritized Using Integer Priority Levels? You can now edit the Priority...

item.title: How to Create a Direct Native Ads Campaign
item.description: Create an Ad Unit for your native ad   Typically, you will create one Ad Unit per type of ad you’d like to display in an app. For example, if you want to have a banner ad on one screen and a native ad in another, you’d create an Ad Unit for each type. You can create a new “...

item.title: Geo, Connectivity, and Device Targeting
item.description: When you create a new line item (and when editing line items) there are several targeting options available. Please note that you must always target an ad unit when creating a Line Item.   County Targeting: Target your line item to a specific set of countries. By default, when the list is...

item.title: Editing an Order
item.description: This page allows you to edit the Order description, export Order details, and monitor overall performance. This page allows you to pause, resume, archive, or create a Line Item. The ‘Show...
